item.title: PrestaShop Core Monthly - January 2023
item.description: The PrestaShop project had a busy January with a focus on releasing PrestaShop 8.0.1 and final touches for PrestaShop 8.1 before the feature-freeze. Let’s take a closer look at what happened in the project last month. Yes, that really was a very busy January! The current dynamic in the project is at the top level. What happened last month? PrestaShop 8.0.1 PrestaShop 8.0.1 was released on January 6th, and it is the first patch version for PrestaShop 8.

item.title: PrestaShop 8.1 is now in feature freeze
item.description: As of February 1, 2023, PrestaShop version 8.1 has entered the feature freeze phase. This article provides more information about the feature freeze, what the next steps will be, and what to expect from PrestaShop 8.1. Feature freeze for PrestaShop 8.1 As of today, PrestaShop version 8.1 has entered a feature freeze. What is a feature freeze? Feature freeze refers to a specific stage in the software development process after which no new features can be added to a version.

item.title: GitHub Discussions are now enabled in the PrestaShop Project!
item.description: Today, GitHub Discussions are being enabled for the PrestaShop Project. This feature will provide a more organized and easily accessible way for community members to collaborate, ask questions, and share ideas. What are GitHub Discussions? GitHub Discussions is a new feature in GitHub that provides a space for community members to discuss directly on the projectâ€™s GitHub page, similarly to traditional forum boards. This feature is a great way to ask questions, share ideas, and collaborate with other community members, and it has proven its value in other open-source communities.

item.title: PrestaShop 8.0.1 is available
item.description: The first patch version for PrestaShop 8 is now available to download! After a few weeks of intensive work from all project members, the first maintenance release for version 8 is now available. In this patch, you can find more than 30 bug fixes and one performance improvement that prevents clearing the system’s cache for bulk actions performed from the modules list. You will also get changes from the recent PrestaShop patch release 1.

item.title: PrestaShop 1.7.8 is now in the extended support phase
item.description: Now that PrestaShop 8.0 is out, here is a focus on maintained branches of the PrestaShop project and what to expect. Reminder: PrestaShop branching strategy In August 2015 PrestaShop adopted a new branching model for the project. The model was refined over the years, for example with this page on the developer documentation about what bugs do qualify for a patch version or the Backward Compatibility Promise that defines what changes can be introduced in a version, but we can say the model has lived quite well as the project is still following it in 2023.

item.title: PrestaShop Core Monthly - December
item.description: Release of PrestaShop 1.7.8.8 and the autoupgrade module, what’s next for PrestaShop 8, an overview of ongoing work, and much more. This Core Monthly summarizes what happened in the project during the month of December. Dear community, Welcome to the first Core Monthly of 2023! 2022 was a fantastic year for the PrestaShop project, with a new major release, announcement of the upcoming new theme for PrestaShop, and significant changes to the project’s structure, which made it more open than it has ever been.

item.title: PrestaShop 1.7.8.8 Is Available
item.description: It has been decided to deliver a new maintenance release for 1.7.8.x branch. Please note that this will be the last regular 1.7.8.x patch version, as the branch now enters security-only maintenance phase. Next regular patches will now target 8.0.x branch. This release fixes some bugs and regressions as well as a security fix. We suggest upgrading your shop quickly in order to benefit from these fixes. Of course, donâ€™t forget to backup before.
